title: Trial by Kyle trailer: Channel 10 releases promo for Kyle Sandilands' show
text:
He recently faced a major backlash after joking about the Virgin Mary during an ill-advised radio segment.

But Kyle Sandilands' career isn't slowing down, with Channel 10 releasing the first promo for his upcoming show Trial by Kyle on Thursday.

The trailer marks the first time viewers have seen Kyle on screen since an episode of Trial by Kyle aired during Pilot Week last year.

Guess who's back! Kyle Sandilands' career isn't slowing down despite his recent Virgin Mary controversy, with Channel 10 releasing the first promo for his upcoming show Trial by Kyle

In the trailer, a woman approaches the 'The Court of Kyle' for help after her friend took $590 from her to buy lip injections.

'I'm going to take my money from you!' the plaintiff says angrily, to which the defendant replies: 'You brought me here, bro!'

In a bid to settle the dispute, Kyle tells the women: 'You know the saying, don't let a pair of duck lips get in the way of a good friendship!'

Here comes trouble! In the trailer for Trial by Kyle, a woman (left) approaches the 'The Court of Kyle' for help after her friend (right) took $590 from her to buy lip injections

Savage! In a bid to settle the dispute, Kyle tells the women: 'You know the saying, don't let a pair of duck lips get in the way of a good friendship!'

Just like the Pilot Week episode, Kyle will be assisted in court by former Bachelor star and criminal lawyer Anna Heinrich.

Introducing a second case, Anna says in the trailer: 'Matt claims his belongings were stolen from the hostel he was staying in.'

'You cannot prove that it was me!' the defendant yells out, before damning CCTV footage shows him caught in the act.

Helping hand: Just like the Pilot Week episode, Kyle will be assisted in court by former Bachelor star and criminal lawyer Anna Heinrich (pictured)

'Are you trying to seduce me?' The trailer features other highlights from the new series, including a handsome plaintiff (pictured) who leaves Kyle hot under the collar

The trailer features other highlights from the new series, including a handsome plaintiff who leaves Kyle hot under the collar.

'Are you trying to seduce me?' the radio host asks.

But Kyle's playful mood turns when he encounters an outspoken contestant whose 'bloody mouth makes me want to destroy you!'

At the end of the promo, Kyle lays down the law by telling two women arguing over a dog that 'they're both idiots' before slamming the gavel and declaring: 'Case closed!'

Trial by Kyle does not yet have a confirmed airdate.
